item.title: Adaptive Feedback Loops in AI: Transforming Education Through Human-Centered Learning
item.description:
Introduction

The rise of artificial intelligence (AI) is reshaping how we interact with knowledge, compelling education systems to evolve beyond outdated models. As the OECD warns, AI’s ability to outperform humans in reasoning and problem-solving means schools must prioritize intellectual growth, creativity, and civic engagement over mere skill acquisition (Elliott et al., 2024).

Central to this transition are adaptive feedback loops (AFLs) – dynamic systems where learners, educators, and AI collaborate to build responsive, ever-improving learning environments.
